segments.text: I can't believe how much water is overflowing from the sink.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman seems completely oblivious to the mess.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think she should really pay more attention to her surroundings.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The puddle on the floor is getting bigger and bigger.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I notice the water streaming down the cabinet doors, creating a slippery hazard.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: She's just standing there, drying that plate like nothing else matters.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if she's ever going to notice the water or the children behind her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The garden outside looks so peaceful, unlike the chaos inside.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel a bit frustrated watching her ignore the obvious problems around her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The children are being mischievous, and she's not even paying attention.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I hope she wakes up and notices what's going on before it's too late.
segments.speaker: PAR
